item_a.title: Inconsistent terminology - meeting vs session vs appointment
item_a.description: Inconsistent terminology confuses users and makes the app feel less professional
item_a.why_it_matters: Inconsistent terminology confuses users and makes the app feel less professional
item_a.current_approach: Mixed terminology for the same concept: meeting, session, and appointment used interchangeably across the UI
item_a.proposed_outcome: Standardize on one term (meeting is most common) and create a terminology guide
item_a.counter_argument: Different terms may be contextually appropriate; forcing one term could sound awkward in some contexts; recovery community may have preferred terminology
item_a.evidence: Multiple terms for same concept found across meeting-related components

item_b.title: Inconsistent terminology: 'finding' vs 'issue' vs 'item'
item_b.description: Technical debt and audit results are referred to as 'findings', 'issues', and 'items' inconsistently. TDMS uses 'items', audit docs use 'findings', GitHub uses 'issues'.
item_b.recommendation: Establish convention: Use 'finding' for audit outputs. Use 'item' for TDMS technical debt entries. Use 'issue' when referring to GitHub issues. Update docs to follow pattern.

item_a.title: Duplicate pattern check runs in both pre-commit and pre-push
item_a.description: Saves 1-2s per push and reduces false graduation in the new graduated enforcement system
item_a.why_it_matters: Saves 1-2s per push and reduces false graduation in the new graduated enforcement system
item_a.current_approach: npm run patterns:check runs in both pre-commit (blocking) and pre-push (blocking). The pre-push check adds no value since pre-commit already caught violations
item_a.proposed_outcome: Remove pattern check from pre-push hook, keeping only in pre-commit. Pre-push should focus on checks not already done (circular deps, type check, security audit)
item_a.counter_argument: Pre-push is a safety net for cases where pre-commit was bypassed (--no-verify). Defense in depth principle says redundancy is acceptable
item_a.evidence: Both .husky/pre-commit and .husky/pre-push run npm run patterns:check

item_b.title: Duplicate: Pattern compliance runs in both pre-commit and pre-push
item_b.description: 'npm run patterns:check' runs twice - once in pre-commit (line 35) and again in pre-push (line 26). Same files checked twice adds 1-3s per push. Pure waste since files don't change between commit and push.
item_b.recommendation: Remove pattern check from pre-commit OR pre-push. Recommend keeping in pre-commit only (fail fast) and removing from pre-push line 21-35. Pattern violations should be caught at commit time.
evidence: [Acceptance] Pattern check runs only once per commit/push cycle
